fields.value: Sanctions in the Justice System, 1942-1977: The Effects on Offenders in Racine, Wisconsin

dsDescriptionValue.value: The purpose of this data collection was to evaluate the effectiveness of judicial intervention and varying degrees of sanction severity by comparing persons who have been processed at the juvenile or adult level in the justice system with persons who have not. The main research question was whether the number of judicial interventions and severity of sanctions had any effects on the seriousness of offenders' future offenses or the decision to desist from such behavior. Variables include characteristics of the person who had the police contact as well as items specific to a particular police contact. Others are the number of police contacts, seriousness of police contacts, severity of sanctions, and age, cohort, and decade the contact occurred.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

value: personal interviews, and official police records
Persons in Racine, Wisconsin born in 1942, 1949 and 1955.

fields.value: The sample population included 6,127 persons from three  birth cohorts, (1942, 1949, and 1955).
